heisig_chinese_memo: The number 100 (hundred) turned on its side
heisig_story: The Japanese refer to a person's 99th birthday as a "white year" because white is the kanji you are left with if you subtract one from a hundred.

koohiiStory2: That dirty ceiling was painted WHITE a hundred times!
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There is a leaf growing out of the sun! You fly out into space to check it out and when you get closer you see that it isn't just one leaf, it's a hundred! That makes sense, you wouldn't be able to see just one leaf on the sun from where you were on earth.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine flying toward the sun to see a hundred leaves growing together in the shape of one big leaf. You want to go closer!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You fly closer, counting all one hundred leaves when you hear a strange sound. You take off your space helmet and hear, "GUH HYUCK (ã²ã‚ƒã)!" You know that laugh... it's Goofy! On top of the hundredth leaf is Goofy laughing and waving around. He must have built this leaf tower to get your attention.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imaging hearing Goofy guh-hyuck over and over after you save him from being stranded on the sun. How would you feel being stuck in a cramped ship with laughing Goofy and his hundred leaves? Oh, you thought he would leave those behind? Nope, they saved him so you have to take them back too. Happy travels!

Jiajin inscriptions start with " one " and " white " sound, and are combined with " one " and " white ". In ancient times, " white " was used to express the numeral " hundred ", and " one " was added to " white " to express "one hundred". Later, because the ancients read "one hundred" habit of eliminating the " a " word, so from co-text "one hundred" in the word became " one hundred ." The original meaning is " hundreds " for thousands.

"Said Wen": "Hundred, ten and ten. From one, white. Counting, ten hundred is consistent. Xiangzhang also. ğ¦£», ancient Chinese hundred." The ancients borrowed " white " to mean the number " hundred " and added " one. " It is used as a combination of "one hundred" on the word " white ". " One hundred " central character again and again " into " form, in order to distinguish between " white " and " one hundred ." In the late Shang Dynasty, the word " bai " was added with " two " to make "two hundred" combined text, and " three " was added to "three hundred" combined text (Zhou Fagao). Later, because the ancients read "one hundred" often eliminating the need for " a ", so from " a ", " white word" sounds became words " one hundred ." Yu Shengwu and Ji Xusheng think that adding " one " to " white " is a pen instead of a text, and it can be said.

And " one hundred " word font text in the Warring States divided into two categories, one inherited two weeks from the text as " a ", " white " A Silent Voice, or add the word to a pen decorated with paintings. The other suspect from " one hundred or directly pour the text" of the " white evolved" word, the Senate "ancient seal compilation" 4743,4745 and 4746 glyphs. Yu Ding: "Hundred Cheng" refers to one hundred military vehicles, "Zuo Zhuan. "Twenty-eight years of the public": "Siesuke Baicheng" refers to one hundred chariots driven by four armored horses. Or from the number of " hundreds " to the meaning of many, such as Jue Shengxun: "It has a hundred sons, hundreds of daughters and thousands of grandchildren."

Radicals: æ—¥  (sun, leaf)
Meaning Mnemonic
There is a leaf growing out of the sun! You fly out into space to check it out and when you get closer you see that it isn't just one leaf, it's a hundred! That makes sense, you wouldn't be able to see just one leaf on the sun from where you were on earth.
Imagine flying toward the sun to see a hundred leaves growing together in the shape of one big leaf. You want to go closer!
Reading Mnemonic
You fly closer, counting all one hundred leaves when you hear a strange sound. You take off your space helmet and hear, "GUH HYUCK (ã²ã‚ƒã)!" You know that laugh... it's Goofy! On top of the hundredth leaf is Goofy laughing and waving around. He must have built this leaf tower to get your attention.
Imaging hearing Goofy guh-hyuck over and over after you save him from being stranded on the sun. How would you feel being stuck in a cramped ship with laughing Goofy and his hundred leaves? Oh, you thought he would leave those behind? Nope, they saved him so you have to take them back too. Happy travels!
